intro: Lampocarya aspera, commonly known as the roughleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has rough, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into elongated seed pods. It thrives in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and gravelly soils. Its botanical features make it identifiable and ecologically significant in its native range.
